title: What's your favourite under-rated Rust crate and why?
selftext: For me it was [conread](https://github.com/kanidm/concread) having a set of concurrent data structures that works off a eventually consistent style strategy is just awsome for heavily concurrent code (most notably the lru cache replacement is awsome!) rather than having a lock(s) to achieve the same goal which can get stalled readers / writers.
